column4: : Either or both. the case fan will blow out warm air that has built up in the box, the cpu fan will try to cool the chip directly, There is a trade off for noise of course..
take a look at www.overclockers.com for hints and tips! :)
thermal paste does make a difference yes, air is a good insulator
Getting a cpu fan that just blasts hot air onto your cpu is not going to help too much.. You really need to look at cooling the ambiant temperature if you can.  :)
Fans are cheap anyway, get both, its cheaper then replacing you cpu! Sorry I missed p0windah post! :)
You can buy a portable airconditioner for around 250 that would be the best solution if you can afford it.
have a look around the overclockers site, the give different priced solutions, including vents that may be less cost/hassle in the long run. http://overclockers.com/articles1256/
i need the room to be cooler, not the cpu
use zsnes and get mario roms
now thats using the ol' noodle :D
not sure, but mariokart has split screen, i know it is a bit old school but....
>> still works fine with a touch'ed file...
